snippet: American intelligence officials have concluded that the government of Kim Jong-un was “centrally involved” in the attacks on the film company’s computers.
abstract: American officials conclude that massive cyberattack on Sony Pictures was state-sponsored action by North Korea; Obama administration has not publicly accused country or decided how to respond; North Koreans half-deny involvement; Sony cancels release of movie The Interview after threats are made to public safety.

byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER and NICOLE PERLROTH
byline.contributor: David E. Sanger reported from Washington, and Nicole Perlroth from San Francisco. Michael Cieply contributed reporting from Los Angeles.

lead_paragraph: American intelligence officials have concluded that the government of Kim Jong-un was “centrally involved” in the attacks on the film company’s computers.

headline.main: U.S. Said to Find North Korea Ordered Cyberattack on Sony
headline.print_headline: U.S. Is Said to Find North Korea Behind Cyberattack on Sony
